summary: The Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit Enhancement Act of 2025 aims to enhance the existing tax credit.  It modifies the applicable percentage calculation based on adjusted gross income, increases the dollar limits on creditable expenses, and establishes a special rule for married couples filing separately. Furthermore, it mandates inflation adjustments for the credit's parameters beginning in 2025 and makes the credit fully refundable for certain taxpayers residing primarily in the US. The changes are effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2024.
